text:
<!channel>: Has anyone messed around with this prototyping tool

<http://www.invisionapp.com/>

We need to send out some design homework for interns and I'm looking for a replacement for Field Test.
I think this is the one Melissa was telling me about a while back. She may know some things about it.
Its pretty rad. Only used it once though.

Not sure if it's hitting the same needs for what you're looking for, but when I did some research into prototyping software, I found I most enjoyed <http://pixate.com|pixate.com>, it's a layer based prototyping tool that you can essentially assign transitions/gestures to individual assets that you place into your project... rather than drawing hit zones on top of static comps. Worth a look, I'd say.
I think it's smartphone app specific though.
Awesome. Thanks guys. I think I want to keep it as simple and basic as possible, which probably means static comps + hot spots. That's what was great about Field Test.

Invision is probably a safe bet then. I think I may have actually used it myself in my search. It's pretty straightforward. I just remember feeling limited for what I wanted to do with it. But for comp-based prototyping I think it's a nice tool.
Perfect. Looks like they have a killer help section too. I just want these kids to be able to create cool stuff without getting too into the weeds.
Don't give them Quartz Composer then.
I've used invision a ton in the past. Great tool
